alert.note: Alert for Jim Hogg; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 16 at 4:32AM CST until February 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...ELEVATED TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS AND RIO GRANDE VALLEY THURSDAY... .A cold front will bring in low humidity and gusty northwest winds this morning. When combined with cured fuels and moderate to severe drought conditions, this could lead to the rapid and erratic spread of wildfires. Conditions will improve rapidly after sunset Thursday with diminishing winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON CST TODAY FOR STRONG WINDS, CURED FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR ZAPATA, JIM HOGG, AND STARR COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds, cured fuels, and low relative humidity values, which is in effect from 9 AM this morning to noon CST today. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect and has been upgraded to a Red Flag Warning. * AFFECTED AREA...Zapata, Jim Hogg and Starr. * TIMING...9 AM TO 12 PM. * WINDS...North 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 60s. * LIGHTNING...Very low chance. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
